Reviews.Title: “Great balance between price and quality”
Reviews.Author: cathroma
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised to see that this hotel has renovated it's lobby, bar, restaurant and some of the rooms. I had a lovely quiet room and had the chance to enjoy the modern mosaic designed bar when I came back in the evenings from the stressful city center. I found the hotel to be convienent, clean and updated. I had one of the newly renovated rooms and loved the fact that the Fitness First health club was next door. I was surprised to see that this was included in the price of the room. I stayed her one year ago and have to say I was pleased to see all the renovations taking place. to me it was a great value beween price and quality will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but hardly four stars”
Reviews.Author: Elias0572
Reviews.Content: Nice personal. Good room. Ongoing renovation caused some noise (daytime). Air condition was designed more to cool the room than to warm it, so we felt chilly early in the morning (then it was about +12C outside and +17C near the window). The location not quite convenient (one depends on a bus or taxi for getting anywhere). Everything around seems to be closed by 20:00.

Reviews.Title: “A great find on the outskirts of Rome best hotel at this price and they're making improvements”
Reviews.Author: TravelGems44
Reviews.Content: I stayed at hotel raganelli for 4 nights in August 2011 with my boyfriend. Rome is a jaw dropping city so we opted for a cheap hotel on the outskirts with the premise that we'd be out exploring most of the time. Our room was just what we needed:a comfy bed, good aircon, tv with a couple of English channels and a clean bathroom. No frills just basics and it could do with a facelift as the carpet and walls were a bit tired. They were doing a gradual refurb so I'm sure the rooms will be smartened up by now, they were adequate for us anyway. The bar, breakfast room and reception had already been returned and were very modern and clean looking. Breakfast was great considering the price. Fresh bread, spreads, cold cuts, hot drinks and pastries as well as cereal and fruit. Perfect to stock you up for a tough day of sightseeing! The best thing for me about this hotel was the roof terrace! As we travelled in August it was screaming hot by lunchtime. So we'd get up and have an early breakfast, was into town (a short bus ride to the tube and 10mins On tube) get some sights seen as have an early lunch when it started to get hot. Then mid afternoon we'd return to the hotel for a nap and some air con before showering and basking on the roof top terrace watching the sunset and returning to town for the evening. Rome is amazing and a totally different city from morning to night. Book this hotel as I think it's probably better now than we I stayed and it was certainly a good stay for the best price in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Night Ever!”
Reviews.Author: dawnzahra
Reviews.Content: The Ragonellli Hotel description was a total lie! Four stars??? It was a freezing room--the airport shuttle they advertised was 50 Euros (each way!), they did NOT give a complimentary breakfast (as advertised), the staff was rude, the room smelled of smoke, wifi was too expensive to access--in NO WAY was it near a historic district---even the public transportation directions they gave were wrong!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: isolamaddalena
Reviews.Content: some friends of us suggested this hotel in Rome, a four star hotel on the via Aurelia, not far from the Vatican city. we (four adults)booked a family room, and arrived by car at this hotel. best location for people traveling by car. we parked it at the private hotel parking place and went to the center by public bus. the room was clean, and spacious for 4 persons. the staff helped us to visit the best place of the city Rome and gave us good suggestion for bars and restaurants. all was to our satisfaction and will suggest this four star hotel to our friends. not to forget is the wellness and fitness area , circa 2000 square mt. , just beside the hotel which is free of charge for the hotel clients.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ok too far out”
Reviews.Author: PenceOsborne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raganelli for 3 nights and our main memory of the stay was the travelling into and out of Rome. The room needed refurbishing e.g. wall lights broken, bathroom tiles replaced with different patterned ones, doors damaged and repaired badly etc., but were clean and after a full day in Rome sleep was not a problem. The rest of the Hotel was clean and tidy and there was always a member of staff in Reception, who were very pleasant, efficient and friendly. There are a couple of bars and some restaurants close by where we paid 8 euro for pizza and 9 euro for a bottle of Frascati and the area feels safe to walk in. Across the road was the bus stop where you could board a bus to the nearest Metro station (Cornelia) or to the Vatican bus station (about 10 minutes walk to the Vatican museum via a long flight of steps). As at 2011 you could buy a ticket for 3 days which allowed all travel on buses,Metro and trains within Rome for 11 euros or you could get a ticket including all these plus trams and 3 days on the Roma Christiana open top bus for 25 euros. Just remember the Roma Christiana bus runs to 7pm and the Metro stops running at 9pm. After 9pm there is a bus, the MA1, which visits each Metro station and takes about 45 minutes from Termini to Cornelia where you take a bus to Raganelli. (Some of these bus stops may be difficult to find - the stop at Termini for the MA1 is not at the bus station but opposite Macdonalds in the via Giovanni Giolitti and the stop at Cornelia is on the Circonvallazione Cornelia. Having said this there were plenty of tourists staying in this area so not everyone thought it was too far.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and service, inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: DJ_Ides
Reviews.Content: The best aspect of this hotel was the wonderful staff. They were extremely helpful, courteous, and efficient. The rooms of the hotel were not bad (I was in two different "upgraded" rooms). The wireless internet was not working very well in the first room that I was booked into, so they moved me to another room with much better Internet signal. The Internet was fast and worked quite well. Bathroom was clean and everything worked. The room was basic, but clean and pretty spacious. The problem with this hotel is the location: it is in a suburb quite far from the center of Rome. There is a metro line, but it is a 15-20 minute walk from the hotel... quite inconvenient to get to. Also, the Metro (at the time) only ran until 9pm on most nights, so I found myself taking a lot of taxis back to the hotel (~ 15-20 euros from/to the Center). To first time visitors of Rome, I would recommend choosing a hotel with a more central location, although this hotel was a good value for the low price.

Reviews.Title: “Too far out of the city”
Reviews.Author: contraltomo
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews we were anxious about this hotel. This was made worse when, on arrival, 2 people were asking for their money back as the rooms were filthy. We were given one of the renovated rooms which was absolutley fine although rather dark as it was in the basement. The showere was great though and the breakfast was also very good. Unfortunately the hotel was 10 metro stops from the train station followed by 5 stops on a bus. It is ridiculous that Expedia call this a city centre hotel. Also note that , at the moment, the metros stop at 9pm in the evening and it is really difficult to get back to the hotel. I would not recommend this hotel for a holiday trip

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: TJS711
Reviews.Content: We book this supposed 4* hotel through Expedia for a 4 night stay in Rome. When we arrived the en-suite was a small cabin built into the room. The smell from the bathroom pervaded the whole room and was so bad you could not use facilities. There were no towels or coat hangers in the room. When we complained we were told that no other rooms were available but we could upgrade the next day for a price. As a result we left the next day. I can only rate this hotel as terrible as absolutely appalling is not available

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, no frills & far out”
Reviews.Author: Chubear1983
Reviews.Content: I booked this room as I was travelling to Rome to attend a conference at another well known hotel nearby and at the same time do some sightseeing at the weekend. At first sight it’s not the best looking hotel and the room I stayed in with my partner wasn’t as good as we expected. It was rather small and the deco and facilities (tv, wardrobes) were outdated. We also found that the hotel was quite far out from the city centre and main attractions, which meant we had to walk and catch the metro or buses to get about. This was fine during the day after we’d had a good nights sleep and were rearing to go, however after a long day we just wanted to find a nearby restaurant, which was almost impossible apart from the McDonalds which was about 1 miles walk from the hotel as was the nearest metro station. Unfortunately, I did feel the price you pay for this hotel is not justified. On the plus side we did get breakfast which wasn’t bad (cereals, croissants, juice etc) and the service was good. When we booked the room the website also mentions a spa facility, however we were disappointed to find out that this involved the use of a next door public gym which included a sauna and steam room, but no pool or jacuzzi. Overall, it’s not bad if you’re looking for a no frills room and are willing to do a fair bit of travelling/walking to get to places.

Reviews.Title: “Awful disreputable dirty and dishonest”
Reviews.Author: newbizhunter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Raganelli Hotel with my family in late July, 2011. The rooms were dirty, smelled of rank mold and garbage, but we had little choice as to where to go in Rome during the high season. In the middle of the night the ceiling opened up leaking water from their Middle Ages air conditioning system and the resulting flood ruined the brand new Ipad i had purchased, i notified the "hotel management" all of whom said there was nothing that they could do to reimburse me for my $320 US dollars loss. They instructed me to write a letter describing the damage and they assured me they would bring it to the attention of the absentee owner named Mr. Izzo who owns seven or eight other hotels in the Mediterranean region. I submitted my letter July 28th 2011 describing what had happened and asking to be reimbursed. They have not responded not even one time. They are rank criminals banking on the fact that the average American tourist will " just go away". A true "disgrace" giving a black eye to Italy's business owners and tourism industry in general. I will only stay in American owned and operated hotels should I ever choose to return to Italy for any reason. Its no wonder their economy is in such a shambles and people are marching and rioting in the streets of Rome. They may be pleasantly surprised should they ever take a page from the Sheraton Hotel whose credo "The customer comes first" really should be the coin of the realm in Rome, Italy. But alas, the credo in the Rome Hotel industry at least in this small Raganelli Hotel sector is "screw the customer and ignore him - who cares!". Really too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much...definitely not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Ian S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is dirty and uncomfortable... the hotel staff basically admitted that the hotel is not really 4 stars and that is why they are undergoing "renovations". The rooms are tiny (even for Europe/Italy standards) and the room itself is filthy; we found stains on the bedsheets multiple nights. We've stayed at many hotels in Europe (and many very cheap motels), and this 4 star hotel still wins the prize for most uncomfortable beds. It's 2 small beds pushed together to make 1 queen sized bed that is full of uneven springs (and never really stays together). Another thing to note is that the location is quite far from anywhere a tourist wants to go. I would suggest staying close to a metro if you want to stay outside of the main areas of Rome (the bus is very infrequent and ALWAYS super packed when it does come) They have an agreement in place with a fitness center beside the hotel, but only 4 guests are allowed to use it at a time. For 6 days straight, this was never available to us as there was always 4 guests already using them.

Reviews.Title: “recomend to everybody!”
Reviews.Author: Zoubin
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Raganelli Hotel from 29 aug. '11 - 2 sep '11. We had really a great time, it's not expensive, but has the best quality of service and is very comfortable / clean. The staf is very very kind and give you the information you need any time. The breakfast is good! You actually get a lot for what you pay, and it's really to recomend to every one! Zoubín

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: atifachiragh
Reviews.Content: This hotelroom was gross. Don't be fooled by the shiny new modern lobby. Our hotel was unsanitary. The microfiber headboard had mysterious white stains. The bottom edge of the bed frame had brown/red stains. I woke up with bite marks on my legs. The breakfast was okay, but once 10 AM hit they actually turned off the lights to get ride of the guest finishing up their meal.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, felt well taken care of, good value for money, free gym”
Reviews.Author: CarlaMa
Reviews.Content: this is a hotel for people that value service and cleanliness. Good value for the money. some rooms are still on 3 star level while others are already on 4 star. we stayed at the raganelli because we arrived by car and it is easy accessible from the highway and it had parking...its not in walking distance to the vatican (what is?), but still in the city. you walk 15 minutes to the subway or take the bus that leaves right in front of the hotel...be prepared to walk a lot when in rome!! it is a huge city :) hotel is being renovated, we did not feel disturbed though. we had two totally different rooms. one more like 3 star and one top 4 star!! not with the same price of course. the new room was amazing, very modern!! the old room was charming, had a 70s flair, very italian, they had a good size though and it was perfectly clean. The staff was very helpful, spoke perfect english.hotel is run by 2 german-italian brothers who told us they are doing renovations from 3 to 4 star...breakfast room was already renovated and very modern, also the bar. we felt very welcome!! i hope this helped you and that you have a great stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Samleigh17
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend had booked Rome for a Birthday Surprise as I had always wanted to come to Rome. On arrival we pulled up to the hotel and first impressions were not great. The Building looks old and definately not to the standard as per the pictures. Not to be put off I thought it must be better inside the Reception Area was fine and the Bar Area was modern & clean so thought it cannot be that bad. We were checked in and were given our keys to Room I can't remember the No. but it was one with a Balcony and a view over the main road which was extremely noisy! Luckily we were that tired on a night from all the sightseeing that we managed to sleep through the noise. The room was tired there was scuff marks all over the walls, the mattress was not great, TV hardly any reception, and the windows were all rotten. Bathroom was fine although the Shower looked as if it had seen better days. We were obviously NOT in a room that had been modernised. We went to breakfast in the morning only once as the food was poor - we preferred to eat out anyway. Location was quite a way out and we travelled using the buses which was a bit of a pain. Luckily we were out sightseeing most of the day and didn't get in till late so we didn't complain as it was somewhere to change and sleep only. I would definately recommend staying somewhere nearer to the centre, although the staff were very friendly and helpful. I would not stay again though.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here till renovations are complete.”
Reviews.Author: Hindsight_CA
Reviews.Content: We were initially given a completely unacceptable room that I would not have stayed in for free much less paid for. It smelled - and they knew it - windows were wide open with no screens so there were several flies in the room. There was a burn hole in the middle of the bed cover. No curtain!? All around dirty and moldy. When I called to complain to the front desk the initial response was that there were no other rooms available. When I told him I wasn't staying he said he would look again and call me back. By the time we lugged our stuff back downstairs he said he did have a room on the first floor but that there were some renovations being done in the adjacent room that my be noisy - if they don't work thru the night that is not a problem. I point blank asked him three times if he had ever seen the room he put us in initially - because if he had I wanted to know how he could, in good conscience book that room. I could not get him to answer the question. The room on the first floor was grungy but comparatively tolerable. We didn't want to waste our time in Rome searching for another hotel, so we stayed. The hotel is located on a busy street - I could hear every car that drove by - if it was a large vehicle the windows shook - the bathroom woodwork was molded and smelly because the shower curtain did not contain the water. The lobby and dining area of the hotel had already been refurbished and were quite nice, I assume the renovated rooms will be nice as well, so make sure if you book here you get a new room. Upon check out the staff politely inquired what our further travel plans were and when we told them Assisi - he insisted we go to nearby Trevi - they have a partner hotel there and could get me a good rate - he assured me we would love Trevi. He was on the phone trying to book us into the Trevi property and I had to stop him - given our experience at this hotel I wasn't in a hurry to book anything with/thru them. Trevi was on the way so we stopped to tour around a bit - It would be perfect for Halloween - it is a small dismal, grey little town and we couldn't even find a place open to have lunch. Even the church was locked tight. I would not recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: samisthabomb
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this hotel! While the rooms were dated and the bathroom even more so (but it had a bathtub), the service and other amenities made up for it. I'll start with my room. While it showed some signs of aging (i.e. tube TV, some rust/scratches), keep in mind that most European hotels can't offer the same amount of "newness" as American hotels offer without a complete renovation, since most American hotels are newer and are members of much larger chains. The beds were very comfortable and clean. There was a large closet in the entryway. The room was equipped with international plug outlets, a huge plus in my book. The bathroom was the only downside - it was one of the notorious "un-renovated" bathrooms with old tile (some of it missing), an ancient hairdryer, and extreme signs of age. The door to the bathroom wouldn't lock, but I didn't find this to be an issue. I actually like this bathroom more than the renovated bathrooms, as it had a bathtub (the only one I saw out of 4 hotels) and was pretty spacious. My favorite part of my room was the balcony. Not all the rooms in the hotel have a balcony; only rooms on the front side do. While it was aged (some rust), my balcony offered wonderful views of Rome. Overall, the room was great. For a mid-sized hotel, Raganelli offered quite a few amenities, including a large fitness center (in a separate building next to the hotel) and free breakfast. My favorite amenity was the roof garden, which offered a 360 degree view of Rome and a great place to relax and hang out with friends. I was very impressed! While most European hotels make you pay for more "hearty" breakfast food, Raganelli offered a wonderful breakfast that inlcuded pepperoni, salami, cheese, yogurt, cereal, assorted breads, pastries, pound cake, amazing coffee, and much, much more. Raganelli Hotel also offers an American bar and wireless internet (for an additional fee). During my stay, the front desk staff was very friendly and did everything to satisfy your personal requests. I was very impressed with the hotel's main lobby. It was huge and had many meeting places for guests. There was modern, relaxing music playing and a large plasma TV was playing Italian TV shows. The overall mood and decoration of the lobby was very modern (I loved the design). Despite what others have posted, I found the hotel pretty close to the Vatican and central Rome (about 20-30 minutes; definitely not an hour). While it is true that Raganelli is near a residential area, the hotel was surrounded by stores and cafes. Overall, I had a wonderful experience at the Raganelli Hotel and would definitely stay there again! Definitely a 4 star hotel, just an older one :) P.S. - The noise level wasn't very high!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Vector4530
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Rome was incredible but we wanted to leave early because of this hotel. This hotel is touted as a 4-star hotel but is nowhere near that! The basic rooms are just plain disgusting- they are very rundown, the bathrooms are small, and the windown shades did not even work. We had to "upgrade" to a "Deluxe" room in order to even want to stay. This room was only slightly better, however. The heater did not work and after several times informing the front desk about this, they finally gave us a space heater on the last night. There were cockroaches that came in to our room under the door from the bar area, the walls are paper-thin so you can hear everything from the common areas as well as the rooms adjacent to ours. There was exposed wiring in the bathroom, and the hot water did not work at all on our last day- so we went to the airport feeling dirty to start our trip home. We loved Rome and we are definitely going to return, but never to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome...”
Reviews.Author: brian_parsons87
Reviews.Content: As with other reviewers, I just wish that the Raganelli was a little more honest in its advertising. It is only close to the Vatican in the sense that Hamersmith is close to Buckingham Palace. I was sufficiently misled to attempt to get to the hotel on the Metro - got lost and had to go back to the central station - taxi 50 euros - taxi drivers comment equivalent to 'I don't go sarf of the river mate'. To get to the bits of Rome that you want to see, you either walk for 20 mins to the Metro 'Cornelia' or get a (frequent, except on Sundays!) 247 bus from across the road, which takes about 20 mins to get to the Metro station 'Citro', which is in the Vatican area. The problem is that when you get back to the hotel there isn't much to do - a couple of restaraunts (of mixed quality) within walking distance. Take a good book! You are not therefore staying within the splendour that is Rome -waking up and going to bed amongst the most amazing sights and buildings. However, you will get to see the rather more real Rome and some real Italians! I fould the hotel to be comfortable, staff helpful, breakfast repetitive - but I would have been fine with the hotel if the blurb wasn't so misleading.

Reviews.Title: “"Situated close to the Vatican" !!!!!!!!!!??????”
Reviews.Author: muirisofclare
Reviews.Content: The hotel, which gives itself four stars, says on their web site that they are "situated close to the Vatican City." It takes an hour to go by bus or bus-and-subway from the hotel to the Vatican. If that's "close," I dread to think what their definition of "far" would be. I'd give it two stars.

Reviews.Title: “raganelli ?”
Reviews.Author: shirley011
Reviews.Content: just returned from a five day stay at this hotel, and for what we paid this was good value but it is not near to the centre of rome you have to get bus and then the metro to wherever you want to see although the bus stop is across the road you can wait up to 20 mins and then you have get the metro which is very regular and fast altogether each tip can take between 20 and 40 mins tomake which can be a bind every day. taxi's to the hotel are very expensive so pre book your transfer's if possible, make use of the hotel's roof terrace this is a nice feature but forget ths bar this is not the place to sit and have a drink it is , a waste of space. all in all, if you get this hotel for a good rate and are prepared to travel into the city then you could do a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “A staff of reception does'nt make everything.”
Reviews.Author: carmelid44
Reviews.Content: The staff of this hotel is very nice. Really kindly. But it does'nt make everything ! The hotel is very far from the center of Roma. It is necessary to wait between 40 and 55 minutes before seeing the bus arriving. Sunday: just one bus for all the line ! Useless to say that without car I do not recommend it to you. Furthermore, in the week, our sheets of our bed were never changed. There is three television channel and only in Italian. The bedding is very bad. There is only a single socket in the room ! The wireless Internet is not free. This hotel is noisy. So many difficulties to sleep. In brief, I preferred to pay 270 euro of modification of plane ticket and not to stay five days which stayed. Restaurants near the hotel are very very expensive. The bonus of the hotel is the fitness room. Except when you are a sportsman, I would recommend you a hotel near hotel of the center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean hotel, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Alicia227
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from 3-7 May 2010 with my husband and another couple. Took taxi from airport to Hotel - cost 53Euro. We thought ok between 4. Hotel staff (apart from one) friendly and spoke good English. Rooms could do with a freshen up, but clean and bed comfortable. Toilet had recently been refurbished and we had a walk in shower. Breakfasts plentiful. Cold ham, salami and slices of cheese. Bread, different types of bread roll, toaster, 3 or 4 different types of cerial, fresh milk, juices, coffee, tea bags (all types), yoghurt. Jams and spreads. Danish and croisants. We were at the front of the hotel and noisy from traffic, but we coped. Take No 247 bus (stop across the road) to metro about 4 stops away, then metro line A to most of the attractions. Spagna is the stop for Spannish Steps, stop next to that is for Trevi Fountain but easy walk from Spannish Steps. 4Euro a day for bus/metro/tram ticket. Take 246 bus back to hotel (again stop just outside) and you would catch the bus just outside a Macdonalds. Metro stop across the road from that. Buses ran about every 15 minutes and we never had to wait more than 7 or 8 minutes for one. Bar quite nice, you have to get reception staff to come and serve you. 6Euro for G&T and I think 5 for Peroni beer. Got hotel to book a taxi for us back to airport and paid hotel 65Euro, however taxi driver had his meter on and had we got the taxi ourselves, it would have been just under 40. However we were leaving the hotel at 7.30 in the morning and didn't want to risk not being able to get one at that time in the morning by just flagging one down. Come out of hotel and turn left you will come to a tobaconist - buy your transport tickets there. Go further down and you will come to a restaurant - not recommended. The one next door to it with glass fronts is much better and not bad prices. 3Euro to use internet at hotel for half hour. Handy to have to check flights due to volcanic ash distruptions. I would recommend the hotel and we all had a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “four star hotel in Rome in the Vatican Area with wellness and fitness”
Reviews.Author: romolo2009
Reviews.Content: we booked this four star hotel in Rome thanks the good reviews on tripadvisor. we arrived by car, the hotel has a free parking place. good location easy to reach the vatican museum and vatican city. the staff is friendly , the room was very spacious and clean , the bathroom with a Jacuzzi idromassage bath-tub was a dream. we had also the possibility to use free of charge the big bitness and wellness area, circa 2000 sq.m. with SAuna and turkish-bath. good value for money. In the new breakfast room on the ground floor we had every morning a very reach buffet breakfast.all was to our satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Great, would come back!!”
Reviews.Author: ourworldtrip2009
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at this hotel the manager greeted my son and I with an enthusiastic and warm welcoming and supplied us with a map and customised public transport information pertaining to the hotel and explained it verbally also, I must say despite the long hours the day manager works he was always friendly and helpful as were all the staff, in fact we never had to mention our room number as they made it a point to know the guests. As for the hotel, well considering the price it was a great value choice, it wasn’t in the central area but not far away and the Italian culture is more evident and that’s what we enjoyed. The hotel is being refurbished so there is a mix of new and old but all the bathrooms seem to be completed and they are fantastic so I can only imagine how the hotel will look after all the modifications. The breakfast is complimentary and is served in the refitted dining area and there are a great selection of patisseries, savouries, cereals etc and juices and various hot drinks also and if you feel guilty from the excessive breakfast the hotel provides the guests with complimentary guest memberships at the adjoining Fitness First club which is very good value. With all this I must admit just being welcomed and remembered as a guest is the very reason I would come back as too often guests are hardly given a thought in many hotel chains....anyhow we had a great stay. Peter Perth, Western Australia

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was ok...”
Reviews.Author: amarilloazul
Reviews.Content: The hotel was okay, nothing to get excited about, the staff was very nice and helpful. This is NOT a 4 star hotel according to the US standars, it may get a full 2 but nothing else. Definately far out and not close to the Vatican you have to take a bus and walk for 20min after.

Reviews.Title: “good four star hotel in rome in the vatican area”
Reviews.Author: carlomeier
Reviews.Content: I was by car for business in Rome and I booked this four star hotel for is good location on the Via aurelia. they have free parking place. the staff is very professional and always friendly. the large and clean room had a luxux bath room weith a jacuzzi bath-tub. WI.FI. free of charge internet connection was perfect for my contact. the best is the fitness and wellness area of circa 2000 sq. m. where I have been every evening. Sauna. turkish bat and many tecnical instrument for body building. all free of charge for the clients of Raganelli hotel. it is a good place where to stay for business of for leasure.

Reviews.Title: “four star hotel in rome italy near the vatican city with wellness and fitness”
Reviews.Author: cristalsardinia
Reviews.Content: we were looking for a four star hotel in Rome and finded this four star hotel near the Vatican city thanks the reviews of tripadvisor. This four star hotel has a good location on the via Aurelia good connected to the Vatican City with pubblic buses. we had a large and comfortable double room, the bathroom was a dream, with a Jacuzzi idromassage bath-tub. the staff is very friendly and professional. In the new breakfast room we had every morning a reach buffet breakfast. the price was very reasonable , we payed for a double room € 80,00 per night on bed and breakfast basis. all was to our satisfaction. this four star hotel offer to all clients a free entrance the the wellness and fitness center of € 2.000 sq. m. ( sauna, turkish bat and all tenical instrument for body building)

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel to catch a morning flight”
Reviews.Author: PCBeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our last night in Italy. We had an early morning flight out of FCO and wanted an easy drive to the airport. This hotel fit the bill. We drove into central Rome for our last dinner in Italy so really can't comment on what is around the hotel. We had one of the rooms that had not yet been renovated and it was very much in need! OK hotel if you need to catch a flight the next day, probably would not choose this hotel for our sightseeing days in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: russ90210
Reviews.Content: We came in to the Raganelli expecting a not so good stay based on the reviews we read. But in hindsight, I think we were lucky with this place. We were lucky with respect to the public transport, and while the room was very basic, we had an okay stay. The hotel is being refurbished, so it might be really good once all rooms are renovated. Positives: + Buffet breakfast was excellent. Probably one of the best we've come across on our travels through Europe. Cereals were available, toast and a nice assortment of croissants and breads. Cheeses and meats were available as well. We enjoyed making the most of this as the start to our days in Rome. + Service was really helpful and kind to us. We were going to book our tour through a local travel agent, but did it at the hotel instead. We were glad we did this as this ensured a complementary pick up and drop off to the hotel. We had to get up very very early for that tour, and the gentleman at the front desk quickly went down stairs and set up breakfast (which probably wasn't his job) an hour ahead of time for us and a few of the other guests. Were expecting to go to the tour without breakfast. Also, we were helped with our bags to the taxi out of the hotel. + On arrival, they give you a small tourist book of Rome, which is a nice thing to read to get to know what to see and do in Rome. + There was a great restaurant nearby, a pizza and pasta place. As a tip, we enjoyed buying a pizza, take away, avoiding a service charge to sit and took it back to the hotel. + There is also a supermarket a 5 to 10 minute walk down the hill. Depending on what you buy, bringing it back up the hill was okay for us. + We were happy to stay in Rome with the price that we paid. Negatives: - As other reviews have mentioned, we did have to rely on a combination of bus and metro (bus stop 1 minute away from Hotel). However, we had really good luck in this respect, because we never had to wait long for the 247, which takes you to the vatican city, or the 246, which takes you to Cornelia metro station, from which it's easy to get to where you want to go. The front desk is quite helpful when it comes to which bus to catch. If you're pretty mobile and flexible, the public transport is manageable. As a tip, it's good to make sure you get a 1, 2 or 3 day metro/bus pass if you're staying here. On arrival, knowing that getting here wasn't so easy, we planned to catch a cab, but in the end it was easier for us to take our luggage on to the bus than to walk around with it looking for a cab. - Our room was very basic, with a bed, old television, tired old floors and bathroom. There were paper thin walls, we had a group of inconsiderate guests and could hear them at 1am when they arrived. Also, we could hear the toilet flushes from the rooms around us from time to time. Overall, it wasn't the cleanest place we've stayed - Our bathroom was very old and squashy. If you're a generously sized individual, it's going to be tough to get around the cramped bathroom. - Wireless internet was not a free service, but at least it was reasonably priced. You may even try negotiating a slight discount which is what we did to get it at half the price for our whole stay. Overall, not the best stay in the world we've ever had, but it served it's purpose in allowing us to explore Rome. Don't be too disheartened if this is the only place you can find at your budget, as a young couple, we were able to manage it alright.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angel_mo
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful room, totally redone and with fancy interior. They almost redid the whole hotel, also the breakfast room looks like a fancy NewYork restaurant. We were a bigger group and one of the couples had one of the last rooms which were not yet redone. It wasn't as modern as ours, basic but clean and tidy. The hotel is not in walking distance to the Vatican, but we took the bus everyday which was really easy. We were arriving by car and it was easy to find. They have parking which is great. the staff spoke perfect english!! what a relief, that doesn't happen too often in italy!! We can only recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Driving to Rome? Choose the Raganelli.”
Reviews.Author: s06
Reviews.Content: I do recommend much the Raganelli hotel for anyone driving to Rome. Of course there are pros and cons. Let's start with the cons. The quality of the room was a little bit subpar. The furnitures looked a bit old, the painting would have deserved some makeover and the air-conditionning was not easily tuned. Then here are the pros, and they are genuinely outstanding. The room was clean, large, and I soon felt comfortable. The help desk, really helpful and kind, did whatever they could to fix and help. The help desk has the most helpful and nice people you can find. The breakfast is ok. And: for a tourist having to come with her or his car, Rome is hell. Finding a off-street parking for your car is nothing but a challenge, and public parking lots are expensive. But the Raganelli hotel provides you with a free parking lot that you can use at your own discretion, and considering the 10+ lots, you are likely not to have any trouble to find one at any time you come. In addition the bus line is across the street. It commutes to the subway. It means that in about 30mn or 40mn you are downtown at the very centre of Rome. Only drawback: the last bus back to the hotel was at 10pm, and since the neighborhood was a bit sad, I prefered be back in time. To sum up, if a tourist comes with her or his car and is looking for correct rooms with helpful services, she or he should consider the Raganelli's as the best place to leave the car and enjoy Rome by public transportation, without the hell of wondering about parking.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great a place”
Reviews.Author: DoobyUK
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a great long weekend in Rome. The weather, food and vino were great but sadly The Raganelli Hotel failed to deliver. Our room was very basic and faced the main road so we could hear traffic throughout the evening. The room was an average size but painted bright pink and the bathroom was fine. The hotel is located very far away from the centre and you're dependant on getting a bus to the Metro and then a train. Trains stop at 10:30 so a taxi is needed in the evenings which around €15-20. Apart from the distance and need of redecorating the staff at the Raganelli were great and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: robbynaish1900
Reviews.Content: If I had to review this hotel in just a few words: It was just perfect !! everything ! Excellent staff, great location, wonderfull room (completely renewed ), really clean and all in all I could not find one thing to complain ...everything was great ! Thank you so much for such great days...see you next year again !

Reviews.Title: “first time good choice”
Reviews.Author: frankly88
Reviews.Content: i have been with my mother at the raganelli hotel and we had a good stay. very nice and comfortable room, good service and my mother have found that the hotel manager was charming !!! I find very nice the girl at the breakfast room. all the staff was very kind and professional. just next to the hotel there a wellness and fitness center very big at free of charge for the hotel guest. the hotel is very good connected with the vatican, you just take the bus in front of the hotel and in 10 minutes you are at the Vatican museum. the recetionist gave us very good turistic suggestion, there is a nice restaurant at 100 m. from the hotel where you can have a good dinner at resonable price. the hotel was to our satisfaction. I'll raccomant it to all my friend

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Raganelli”
Reviews.Author: Bri-bern
Reviews.Content: My aunt and I have just returned from our third visit to the Raganelli. As usual our stay was fabulous. The newly renovated room provided was of an exceptionally high standard which was very clean and comfortable. The bar area is also comfortable with hot & cold drinks available - a definite bonus after a day out! The locality of the hotel is another bonus as the direct bus route into the city makes it accessible to elderly travellers as well as the young at heart. The breakfast service provided by a friendly young lady was excellent; the choice of food and the quality was of a very high standard. But by far the best quality of this hotel are the wonderful reception staff who are friendly and professional and whose fluency in English is excellent. Without a doubt this team makes anyone who stays at the Raganelli want to return. We are looking forward to our next stay at the Raganelli and would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerMilan
Reviews.Content: As usual I came for work here to Rome but unfortunately my usual Hotel I' ve always stayed was fully booked; My secretary organized another solution and booked for me 3 nights in the Raganelli Hotel having seen that this Hotel had a free privat parking (absolutely a must for me) travelling by car, Internet connection with wireless is important as well for me and the possibility to relax after a busy day is a primary point as well . Well all this things had the Raganelli Hotel. But this is not the only positive thing about this structure. The Reception staff was highly professional, fast,really friendly and helpfull; The room was a good three star standard, very clean and a really good matress that permitted me to have a great sleep. I enjoed also every morning the breakfast in the room that was brought me on a silver tray from a nice and friendly lady. Everything fresh and a a lot of choice; Wireless in my room and the possibility to use the fitness center for free beside the hotel was exactly as I wished. I defenetly starting from now will always book here in the raganelli hotel and not anymore in my old Hotel. Hopefully I'll have some occasions to come not only for work here but aslo with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay ! Thanks!”
Reviews.Author: ThinkPositiveMunich
Reviews.Content: I´ve done my reservation on Internet as I do always searching for something not so expensive (in high season in rome it s almost impossible ) somthing not to far from the city centre and it should defently be clean and should have a nice atmosphere inside. This Hotel seemed for us perfect and we hoped to receive what we expected having booked there for 5 nights. I was in holidays with my wife and young doughter. We reached the Hotel by taxi ,so I cannot judge the connection by public transportation ....we payed 50 € from Fiumicino airport; quite reasonable; The first impression :the outside of the Hotel could be better but once inside an extremly friendly lady of the reception that spoke fluently english welcomed us in the hotel asking us as first thing if the trip was ok and explained us on a city map how to visit the city by public transportation and answered to all our several questions that we had. Just Great ! in the notes of our reservation we asked for a quite room and we not only got this but probablly also an upgrade ; Well the room that was given us was in my advise a four star standard room with big a big lcd screen , beautiful bathroom with jacuzzi shower and the possibility to connect my lap top using wireless; We were all really positive surprised; i ve also done some shots ; probably not all rooms are like this one but we´ve seen severals while a housemaid was cleaning other rooms; As the receptionist was telling us , all rooms are beeing renewed. We enjoyed the beatifull sunterrace ; there is may be not the view on vatican square but you see every evening an amazing sunset. My wife and me enjoyed also the sauna and steam bath after so much walking ; completely free of charge ; it s a huge Fitness and wellness centre beside the hotel. The breakfast was also great , lots of choice and to proud is exspecially the freshness of all products! All in all we had great 5 days in the raganelli hotel and we would like to say thank you to all this great,friendly and welcoming staff of this hotel ! We defenetly come again and will suggest to all our friends your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little out of the centre”
Reviews.Author: RovingRich
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located approximately 40 minutes from the Termini station and we found the best way to reach it was by Metro Line A and then either 20 minutes walk or take the 247 bus as instructed on the hotel's website. The area is a little run down, but there were a few other hotels and restaurants within a short distance. The staff were very helpful and spoke excellent English. They not only volunteered a map of central Rome but also gave comprehensive details on which buses to take and which sites to see. Great service! There was a 5 day weather forcast posted by the lift and use of the next door gym was available free of charge. Our room on the 3rd floor was relatively quiet although the single glazing allowed some street noise to be heard - especially sirens from passing ambulances. The room was clean but the decor in need of updating. There was a television with satellite channels and air conditioning (hot and cold). The view from the room was of flat roofs of adjacent buildings. The bathroom was in need of some work including 17 missing tiles (some of which had been replaced by non-matching tiles or simply filled over with grout). The cold water tap on the sink was not possible to turn off fully and there was no plug. There was a bath and shower, although the shower curtain was located at a rather jaunty angle. The paint was peeling from around the window and on the door. Breakfast consisted of pastries, bread, fruit, cereals, yoghurts, cheese, ham and juices and coffee on a self-service basis (plentiful supply). Internet access was available at 3 Euros per 30 minutes. The hotel would suit those travelling on a budget who don't mind a bit of a journey into central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “You gotta lika the raganelli !!”
Reviews.Author: Cumbria_my_lord
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel after going totally the wrong way from the Cornelia station the guy behind the desk was super-friendly. He allowed me to check in a bit early even though it was an hour until proper check in time and he also gave me a map of Rome and explained how to get everywhere, all the staff of multi lingual and extremely friendly. You can have access to the gym next door for free if your a fitness freak. The lounge has a nice feel and you can get hot and alcoholic drinks whenever you want from the staff. There is internet access and wifi for your laptops and the rates are quite reasonable. The hotel is a bit of a way from Cornelia train station but you can either get a bus or walk like me (it only takes 15 mins walk up the road to the metro if you can't be bothered with the bus). The hotel has a number of restaurants nearby which are quite reasonably priced, theres even a blockbusters so you can bring your portable dvd player if you get sick of the farce which is Italian TV (game shows and football). The rooms are nice and clean, although i was gutted that they never had tea and coffee facilities in the room, but that was the only thing that annoyed me really. Breakfast was fantastic a goood choice of cheese, meats, cereals and delicious pastries (mainly custard mmmmm!). I would definetly recommend a stay at the Raganelli!!

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: MaiTravels
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall is not too bad esp for the amount you paid. It's pretty centrally located which is good. Only 3 metro stops from Vatican city or bus 247 goes directly there from the hotel. You get the train to termini then metrol line A to cornelia station (left exit then the right) bus 246 is located right in front of mcdonalds and you get off at the 4th stop and the hotel is about 1min walk ahead of you. The hotel was getting some work done at the time of my stay so it was very noisy very early in the morning. Like around 7ish or earlier. It sucks if you had a big night out and wanted to sleep in!! Breakfast was pretty decent but they didn't have any hotel food provided. Staff was great. Answered my questions and gave a list of things to see and how to get there from the hotel with a map as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff - shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poddy1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided on the Raganelli as most of the reviews seemed quite favourable AND the location was a bonus. This was our first trip to Rome and we were looking forward to being complete tourists for the week !!! As the hotel does not offer a shuttle collection from the airport we had to use the train to Termini station, then get the Metro Line A to Cornelia and then find the 246 bus stop. Those of you choosing this method, at the time of writing this the train fare was 11 Euro one way each and the Metro was about 5 euro for the both of us but the ticket included the bus fare. The location of the bus stop is outside McDonalds ( take the left staircase when u leave Metro station) and be warned it is a VERY busy bus route and it gets extremely crowded. On arrival at the hotel ( 4 stops on the bus) the staff were very friendly and gave us a map of the city which proved invaluable, however once past the reception area the hotel takes on a dated and somewhat shabby appearance, and I must say the room was a disappointment. Although VERY clean the decor was definate '70's - the bathroom door was cracked and slightly warped, the bathroom fittings had lost most of the plating, the lampshades were old and battered no carpet on the floor and finally the wooden window frames had peeling paint and were cracking. The building DEFINATELY needs renovating - Oh yes one more thing - the room had external window shutters that if U lower them at night and there is anything like a stiff breeze blowing - they will rattle in their frames, if you are a light sleeper be warned. Breakfast is the same every day - ham, salami, cheese, cereals coffee juice croissant - which although filling we found by the end of the week we were longing for something cooked - good tip here though - if ur planning on walking and sightseeing make some sandwiches with the breakfast stuff - it can save you a fortune if ur a snack attacker like me !! The location of the hotel is fantastic with all major sights along or very close to Metro line A - we bought a weekly travel ticket for 16 euros each and it saved us money and was very convenient - U buy these at small newsagent units I think called tabccachini ( tobacco) shops. If you are planning a night out and intend travelling by public transport be aware that the Metro ceases to run at 9 pm!!!! buses are available but plan well ahead as the bus stops are not always easy to find. The stops do tell u what time the last bus is but not how often they run. The hotel does have a deal with a local taxi firm for a shuttle service back to the airport - it costs 50 euro but thats all in so if there are several of you travelling it can work out quite cheap. Would we go back to the Raganelli? A reserved yes - if the owners spent some cash on re decoration and the menu could be varied - but for location and friendliness of staff I dont think it can be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “its ok”
Reviews.Author: cjb222
Reviews.Content: good staff. rooms small neeeding renovation. outside the centre of rome, not in a particulary attractive area.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and it's in Rome”
Reviews.Author: londonxray
Reviews.Content: Was sent here for one night because of "a burst water pipe" at my original hotel ( those pesky Italian water pipes again). Appearance of the hotel was a bit shabby, room was decorated in a garish 1970s colour scheme and looked overdue for redecoration. Over the bed is what appeared to be the remains of a radio or intercom set into the wall. I was pleased to see that the earthing cables fitted to the toilet ensured complete safety, obviously complying with the latest standards of electrical safety. Room had a good view and the receptionist was really nice, friendly and helpful and spoke perfect English. Breakfast was good. There is a bus stop opposite where 246 or 247 buses take you to Cornelia Metro station. I waited about 20 minutes for a bus on a Sunday morning and it was packed. Seems like with parking at the hotel ,arriving by car is a lot more convenient than public transport. But for the price, and the fact it's in Rome it is a place to be recommended, go for it !!

Reviews.Title: “A very good experience”
Reviews.Author: travellingscotslady
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early February with a friend. We arranged a pick up from Ciampino airport to the hotel as we were arriving quite late in the evening. A member of staff was waiting and we had a pleasant welcome on arrival. Our room, although listed as a twin, also contained an extra bed. The room was basic, but very clean with en suite. Breakfast was included in the price (about 40 Euros per room per night), and we had a choice of fresh rolls, salami, cheese, croissants, coffee, etc. To reach St Peters, simply turn right as you leave the hotel, cross the road and catch the bus to the bus station. There, transfer for four stops . The staff will provide a map and the numbers, which I forget. Buses are regular. Once you know the route, it is easy to get around. When I return to Rome, I would not consider staying anywhere else. Very good value, pleasant staff, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but comfortable. Nice Staff. Great deal for budget travelling.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: So I'll start off with what seems like a popular topic-the location of the hotel. It is indeed about a 15 min walk to the Metro which is about a 15 min ride to the city center. The 30 min trip from the hotel to city center always seemed very quick. It was never a big deal for me because in Los Angeles the commute can easily be an hour or two. The buses worked out great as well. There was a bus stop directly across the street. They seemed to run about every 10 min so I never had a problem with it. The bus trip to the Vatican was about 15 minutes. I liked the fact that the hotel had free parking in a lot directly in front of the hotel only a few feet from the hotel entrance. This was great to park my rental car and not having to worry about my car or paying a lot of money to park my car somewhere. The neighborhood seemed to be a very quiet residential area although the street the hotel is on is a major street that leads into the Rome city center. I found the location to be great being only a 20 minute drive from Da Vinci airport. When I first saw the room my first impression was you get what you pay for. The bed was comfy and there was a small color t.v. mounted on the wall. The staff was fantastic. Always greeting you when you entered and exited the hotel. They give you a map and tell you how to get into the city. But the greatest thing that I loved about the staff was that one night I came back to the hotel and was starving. The person at the front desk offered and made me four ham & cheese sandwiches and a couple orange marmalade crossaints. It was outstanding!!! The breakfast was simple but free which is a nice way to start off the day. The hotel has a rooftop terrace with a beautiful view of the surrounding area, which is a great place to relax for a few minutes. Anyhow, to sum up the whole experience-the location was decent-the price per night to stay at the hotel was fantastically low-the staff was superb-the room is simple...a bed, a couple lamps, a small bathroom, and a small television. But for such a low low rate per night, what more can you ask for. I could and would definitely not mind staying here again if my travels should bring me back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Tired but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay, rooms large, very clean but 'tired'. Bathroom had been recently re-decorated and was lovely! Breakfast was plentiful and good quality and set you up for the day - reception staff were fantastic and provided maps and guidebooks as soon as we checked in. The only negative aspect is the location - it is easy to walk into the city centre during daylight hours in about 40 mins. But taxis are quick and efficient and don't charge too much. I would recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First impressions not very favourable, as the exterior is somewhat run down, but we were soon made to feel very welcome by the staff. The room we stayed in was basic but very clean, the breakfast was good and the local restaurants reasonably priced. Our kids enjoyed chatting to the staff, who were always happy to help with our queries. Vatican is a bus ride away. Here's a recommendation from my 10 year old son - make sure you remember to bring clothing to cover bare legs and shoulders to gain access to the Vatican...!

Reviews.Title: “shabby, remote, but cheap and clean”
Reviews.Author: ceeljay
Reviews.Content: On arrival (after a 30min taxi journey from the central Termini rail station), our hearts sank as we pulled up outside what appeared to be a dilapidated shack. The reception area was nice and the staff friendly, though, and we kept our fingers crossed that the room would also be ok. Well, it was shabby and tired, but very clean. The bathroom was a bit of a disgrace, damp patches everywhere, shower leaks all the way to the door, wires and pipes exposed, etc, and I don't think we ever got a succesful flush on the first attempt! However, water was hot, pressure fine, what more do you need in a hotel room when you're paying a "budget" price (although we hadn't realised that £80 a night was "budget" in Rome!). As said often enough here, the location is the problem. The Vatican is a 20 min journey on the bus, and the bus to the Metro takes 10 - 15 min (then another 10-15min on the Metro itself). But we were waiting sometimes up to an hour for the bus to arrive. This means 2-3 hours a day are lost to travel time - you have to decide whether it's worth paying an extra £30 - £50 a night for something more central, or lose those hours every day. There isn't any chance to come back to the hotel to rest and freshen up before going back out for dinner. When you go out in the morning you need to have your full day's kit, go to dinner as soon as the attractions shut (6.30ish in October), then back to the hotel, exhausted, usually by about 10pm - not very romantic. The area the hotel is in isn't very nice, and the "restaurant" is open only for breakfast. Oh yes, the Metro had shut at 9pm so we had to pay for a taxi back anyway - 20 Euro I'd rather have spent on a more convenient hotel. Lastly, breakfast was reasonable and plentiful (fresh fruit and very fresh rolls, danish's, cereal, meats and cheeses). Would I stay again? No, would rather pay more for a better location and standard. However, if you are low on funds but time-rich, go for it!

Reviews.Title: “OK - Hard to get around”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Raganelli for 5 nights. The room was OK - nothing great. The buffet in the morning had no fresh fruit, limited selection - not that great. Staff were very helpful. The problem is getting around. You need to get a bus to take you to the Metro or walk 15 minutes on foot to the Metro. The buses are very unreliable and slow. Sometimes they are so backed you cannot get on. Especially if you are trying to get on with luggage. The problem with affordable hotels is they are usually outside of the city which can make getting around a bit of a pain.
